editdialog module

class editdialog.EditDialog(id=- 1)

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

Class for the edit dialog used for adding new application and editing the exiting applications.

icon_img

The icon image saved as QByteArray

Type

QByteArray

id

The Application ID saved in the database. -1 for the new application.

Type

int

new

Boolean value to check if the dialog is for new application or an existing application.

Type

bool

add_envs()

Function to get data from database and add environment variables in the table view in the dialog.

down()

Function for Down button in the environment variable section. It switches the execution order of the selected environment variable with the one below if a variable is selected. Otherwise, it displays a message box to ask user to select a variable.

env_edit()

Function for Edit button in the environment variable section. It opens the environment variable dialog with the existing data and updates the data on return if a variable is selected. Otherwise, it displays a message box to ask user to select a variable.

env_new()

Function for New button in the environment variable section. It opens an empty environment variable dialog and updates the environment variable table when new variable is added.

env_remove()

Function for Remove button in the environment variable section. It removes the selected environment variable from the database and update the environment variable table in the dialog. It displays a message box to ask user to select a variable if not selected.

icon_img: PyQt5.QtCore.QByteArray = PyQt5.QtCore.QByteArray()
id: int = -1
lookup()

Function for the look up button. It allows the user to select an application file and sets the path in the path input field.

new: bool = True
remove_icon()

Function for the remove button. It removes the icon from the button and data from the buffer.

save()

Function for the save button. It inserts a new data into database for add new dialog and update data for edit dialog.

set_pixmap()

Function for the icon button. It allows the user to select an image file, sets the selected image to the button and save the data in buffer.

up()

Function for Up button in the environment variable section. It switches the execution order of the selected environment variable with the one above if a variable is selected. Otherwise, it displays a message box to ask user to select a variable.
